description: Borrowed from Latin cancer (“crab”), by metathesis from Ancient Greek καρκίνος (karkínos, “crab”); applied to cancerous tumors because the enlarged veins resembled the legs of a crab. Doublet of canker and chancre.

adjectives.description: cancer (comparative more cancer, superlative most cancer)

examples: I used to love this game, but the new meta is straight up cancer.

entries.meaning: (medicine, oncology, pathology) A disease in which the cells of a tissue undergo uncontrolled (and often rapid) proliferation.
(figuratively) Something damaging that spreads throughout something else.
